titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: A bright day, but still very cold. I wasted much of the day in collecting materials for an answer to the Dean's questions about Richards. There can be no reasonable doubt that "residence" implies occupancy of the prebendal house, & that it must extend to at least 3 months in the year.
In the afternoon I motored to Sedgefield, & called on Lord Thurlow. He is clearly mending, but will certainly not be equal to his full duty for many weeks yet.
